explanation.text:
Explanation
When the owner of the business withdraws money from the business for personal use, it is called ''drawings'' and must be recorded for future reference.
Any type of drawings reduces the capital or owner's equity of a business, so it is important to keep track of these drawings and manage them within your accounts. However, drawings are not considered a business expense.

owner of the business collects N5,000 from the accountant

explanation.text:
Explanation
The discounts allowed column is on the debit side, while the discounts received column is on the credit side.
The total of the discount column on the credit side represents the total cash discount received from suppliers during the period and is posted to the discount received account maintained in the ledger.

text: The total of the discounts received column in the cash book is posted to the?

options.text: credit of the discounts received account
debit of the discounts allowed account
credit of the discounts allowed account
debit of the discounts received account

text:
A pottery company had sales of N176,000 during the current period and a gross profit rate of 40%.
The company's cost of merchandize available for sale during the period was N128,000. The company's ending inventory is?
subject: ACCOUNTS PRINCIPLES OF ACCOUNTS

explanation.text:
Explanation
equipment price = 18000
salvage value after 8 years useful life = 2000
If in 1996 ( 3 years later) it is sold for 8000, hence we have
18000 - (2000 x 3 yrs = 6000) = 12000
12000 - 8000 = 4000
This means that the equipment was supposed to have been sold for 12,000 after 3years of usage instead it was sold for 8,000. This shows a N4000 loss

(iii) both partners earn interest on capital at 6% p.a.

At the end of the year, Dan drew N15,000 while Baker drew N14,000 in four installment on 31/3,30/6,30/9 and 31/12. The net profit for the year was N48,000. N5,000 is to be written off the Goodwill account.
